intro: Ctenium somalense, commonly known as Somali ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, hot climates. It is often found in coastal and inland desert areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine in the region.
